quote: Read books
author: Deliaha Hicks

quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
author: Roberto Bolaño,  2666

quote: Reading is probably another way of being in a place.
author: José Saramago,  El hombre duplicado

quote: Reading changes your life. Reading unlocks worlds unknown or forgotten, taking travelers around the world and through time. Reading helps you escape the confines of school and pursue your own education. Through characters – the saints and the sinners, real or imagined – reading shows you how to be a better human being.
author: Donalyn Miller,  The Book Whisperer: Awakening the Inner Reader in Every Child

quote: Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: Richard Steele

quote: Reading is going toward something that is about to be, and no one yet knows what it will be.
author: Italo Calvino,  If on a Winter's Night a Traveler

quote: Reading is like travel, allowing you to exit your own life for a bit, and to come back with a renewed, even inspired, perspective.
author: Laurie A. Helgoe,  Introvert Power: Why Your Inner Life Is Your Hidden Strength

quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: Reading is escape, and the opposite of escape; it's a way to make contact with reality after a day of making things up, and it's a way of making contact with someone else's imagination after a day that's all too real.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Reading is reading - no matter what the material.
author: Giovanna Fletcher,  Billy and Me

quote: Read, read, read. That's all I can say.
author: Carolyn Keene,  The Secret of the Old Clock

quote: Reading is sometimes thought of as a form of escapism, and it’s a common turn of phrase to speak of getting lost in a book. But a book can also be where one finds oneself; and when a reader is grasped and held by a book, reading does not feel like an escape from life so much as it feels like an urgent, crucial dimension of life itself.
author: Rebecca Mead,  My Life in Middlemarch

quote: One reads for oneself and for strangers.
author: Harold Bloom,  The Western Canon: The Books and School of the Ages

quote: Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention.
author: Francis Bacon,  The Essays

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

quote: I am not simply teaching the reading; I am teaching the reader.
author: Kelly Gallagher,  Readicide: How Schools Are Killing Reading and What You Can Do About It

quote: What is reading but silent conversation.
author: Walter Savage Landor,  Imaginary Conversations

quote: A good reading strengthens the soul.
author: Toba Beta

quote: When I want to read a novel, I write one.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Reading is very creative - it's not just a passive thing. I write a story; it goes out into the world; somebody reads it and, by reading it, completes it.
author: Margaret Mahy

quote: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Reading is at the threshold of the spiritual life; it can introduce us to it. It does not constitute it ... There are certain cases of spiritual depression in which reading can become a sort of curative discipline ... reintroducing a lazy mind into the life of the Spirit.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Reading is not an end to itself, but a means to an end.
author: Adolf Hitler,  Mein Kampf

quote: I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot.
author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

quote: Read. Read 1000 pages for every 1 page that you write.
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life.
author: W. Somerset Maugham,  Books and You

quote: Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it.Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Write the book you want to read
author: Austin Kleon

quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
author: Harold Bloom

quote: Reading brings us unknown friends
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: We lusty bibliophiles know that reading, unlike just about anything else, is both good for you and loads of fun.
author: Kevin Smokler,  Bookmark Now: Writing in Unreaderly Times: A Collection of All Original Essays from Today's (and Tomorrow's) Young Authors on the State of the Art --and the Art of the Hustle--in the Age of Information Overload

quote: I read my eyes out and can't read half enough...the more one reads the more one sees we have to read.
author: John Adams,  Letters of John Adams, Addressed to His Wife

quote: Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I'm pretty sure my addiction to reading has just reached a whole new level.
author: Colleen Hoover,  Hopeless

quote: Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms.
author: Angela Carter

quote: Reading is my favourite occupation, when I have leisure for it and books to read.
author: Anne Brontë,  Agnes Grey

quote: My life is a reading list.
author: John Irving,  A Prayer for Owen Meany

quote: A fondness for reading, properly directed, must be an education in itself.
author: Jane Austen,  Mansfield Park

quote: Books, I don't know what you see in them. I can understand a person reading them, but I can't for the life of me see why people have to write them.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Read as widely and as deeply as you can. You have to be a reader before you can be a writer.
author: Y.S. Lee

quote: Read everything. Read fiction and non-fiction, read hot best sellers and the classics you never got around to in college.
author: Jennifer Weiner

quote: Education...has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
author: George Macaulay Trevelyan

quote: I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: Read vs. Write If you want to know about life second hand, read;if you want to experience life directly, write.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Reading messed with my brain in an unaccountable way. It made me happy; or something.
author: Salvatore Scibona

quote: Reading a book is like having the ability to dip a straw into the author’s soul and sip and slurp without lowering the water table of wisdom.
author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
